what: admiralpeds: Pediatrics Extension Package for ADaM in 'R' Asset Library — admiralpeds-package
title: admiralpeds: Pediatrics Extension Package for ADaM in 'R' Asset Library — admiralpeds-package
text: toolbox programming Clinical Data Standards Interchange Consortium (CDISC) compliant Analysis Data Model (ADaM) datasets R. ADaM datasets mandatory part New Drug Biologics License Application submitted United States Food Drug Administration (FDA). Analysis derivations implemented accordance "Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide" (CDISC Analysis Data Model Team, 2021, https://www.cdisc.org/standards/foundational/adam). package extension package 'admiral' package.

what: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
text: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles--Age) based Standard Growth Charts Height/Weight/BMI/Head Circumference Age

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
code: derive_params_growth_age(   dataset,   sex,   age,   age_unit,   meta_criteria,   parameter,   analysis_var,   bmi_cdc_correction = FALSE,   set_values_to_sds = NULL,   set_values_to_pctl = NULL )

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified sex, age, age_unit, parameter, analysis_var expected dataset. sex Sex character vector expected. Expected Values: M, F age Current Age numeric vector expected. Note actual age current visit. age_unit Age Unit character vector expected. Expected values: 'days' 'weeks' 'months' meta_criteria Metadata dataset metadata dataset following expected variables: AGE, AGEU, SEX, L, M, S dataset can derived CDC/user-defined datasets. CDC/growth chart metadata datasets available package require small modifications. AGE - Age AGEU - Age Unit SEX - Sex L - Power Box-Cox transformation normality M - Median S - Coefficient variation parameter Anthropometric measurement parameter calculate z-score percentile condition expected input dataset VSTESTCD/PARAMCD want growth derivations: e.g. parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT". CDC/metadata available Height, Weight, BMI, Head Circumference available admiralpeds package. analysis_var Variable containing anthropometric measurement numeric vector expected, e.g. AVAL, VSSTRESN bmi_cdc_correction Extended CDC BMI--age correction logical scalar, e.g. TRUE/FALSE expected. CDC developed extended percentiles (>95%) monitor high BMI values, set TRUE CDC's correction applied. set_values_to_sds Variables set Z-Scores specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_sds(exprs(PARAMCD = “BMIASDS”, PARAM = “BMI--age z-score”)) defines parameter code parameter. formula calculate Z-score follows: $$\frac{((\frac{obs}{M})^L - 1)}{L * S}$$ "obs" observed value respective anthropometric measure calculated. Permitted Values: List variable-value pairs left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset set_values_to_pctl Variables set Percentile specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_pctl(exprs(PARAMCD = “BMIAPCTL”, PARAM = “BMI--age percentile”)) defines parameter code parameter. Permitted Values: List variable-value pair left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
text: input dataset additional records new parameter added.

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Age) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_age
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(lubridate) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘lubridate’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union library(rlang) library(admiral)  advs <- dm_peds %>%   select(USUBJID, BRTHDTC, SEX) %>%   right_join(., vs_peds, by = "USUBJID") %>%   mutate(     VSDT = ymd(VSDTC),     BRTHDT = ymd(BRTHDTC)   ) %>%   derive_vars_duration(     new_var = AGECUR_D,     new_var_unit = CURU_D,     start_date = BRTHDT,     end_date = VSDT,     out_unit = "days",     trunc_out = FALSE   ) %>%   derive_vars_duration(     new_var = AGECUR_M,     new_var_unit = CURU_M,     start_date = BRTHDT,     end_date = VSDT,     out_unit = "months",     trunc_out = FALSE   ) %>%   mutate(     AGECUR = ifelse(AGECUR_D >= 365.25 * 2, AGECUR_M, AGECUR_D),     AGECURU = ifelse(AGECUR_D >= 365.25 * 2, CURU_M, CURU_D)   )  #' metadata is in months cdc_meta_criteria <- admiralpeds::cdc_wtage %>%   mutate(     age_unit = "months",     SEX = ifelse(SEX == 1, "M", "F")   )  #' metadata is in days who_meta_criteria <- bind_rows(   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_age_boys %>%     mutate(       SEX = "M",       age_unit = "days"     )   ),   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_age_girls %>%     mutate(       SEX = "F",       age_unit = "days"     )   ) ) %>%   rename(AGE = Day)  criteria <- bind_rows(   cdc_meta_criteria,   who_meta_criteria ) %>%   rename(AGEU = age_unit)  derive_params_growth_age(   advs,   sex = SEX,   age = AGECUR,   age_unit = AGECURU,   meta_criteria = criteria,   parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT",   analysis_var = VSSTRESN,   set_values_to_sds = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGASDS",     PARAM = "Weight-for-age z-score"   ),   set_values_to_pctl = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGAPCTL",     PARAM = "Weight-for-age percentile"   ) ) #> # A tibble: 246 × 39 #>    USUBJID     BRTHDTC  SEX   STUDYID DOMAIN VSSEQ VSTESTCD VSTEST VSPOS VSORRES #>    <chr>       <chr>    <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <int> <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>   #>  1 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         1 BMI      BMI    NA    16.577… #>  2 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         5 BMI      BMI    NA    16.615… #>  3 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         9 BMI      BMI    NA    16.697… #>  4 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        13 BMI      BMI    NA    16.816… #>  5 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        17 BMI      BMI    NA    16.824… #>  6 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        21 BMI      BMI    NA    16.915… #>  7 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        25 BMI      BMI    NA    17.051… #>  8 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        29 BMI      BMI    NA    17.162… #>  9 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        33 BMI      BMI    NA    17.248… #> 10 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        37 BMI      BMI    NA    17.433… #> # ℹ 236 more rows #> # ℹ 29 more variables: VSORRESU <chr>, VSSTRESC <chr>, VSSTRESN <dbl>, #> #   VSSTRESU <chr>, VSSTAT <chr>, VSLOC <chr>, VSBLFL <chr>, VISITNUM <dbl>, #> #   VISIT <chr>, VISITDY <int>, VSDTC <chr>, VSDY <int>, VSTPT <chr>, #> #   VSTPTNUM <dbl>, VSELTM <chr>, VSTPTREF <chr>, VSEVAL <chr>, EPOCH <chr>, #> #   VSDT <date>, BRTHDT <date>, AGECUR_D <dbl>, CURU_D <chr>, AGECUR_M <dbl>, #> #   CURU_M <chr>, AGECUR <dbl>, AGECURU <chr>, AVAL <dbl>, PARAMCD <chr>, …

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
code: derive_params_growth_height(   dataset,   sex,   height,   height_unit,   meta_criteria,   parameter,   analysis_var,   set_values_to_sds = NULL,   set_values_to_pctl = NULL )

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
text: dataset Input dataset variables specified sex, height, height_unit, parameter, analysis_var expected dataset. sex Sex character vector expected. Expected Values: M, F height Current Height/length numeric vector expected. Note actual height current visit. height_unit Height/Length Unit character vector expected. Expected values: 'cm' meta_criteria Metadata dataset metadata dataset following expected variables: HEIGHT_LENGTH, HEIGHT_LENGTHU, SEX, L, M, S dataset can derived user-defined datasets. growth chart metadata datasets available package require small modifications. Datasets who_wt_for_lgth_boys/who_wt_for_lgth_girls subject age < 730.5 days. Datasets who_wt_for_ht_boys/who_wt_for_ht_girls subjects age >= 730.5 days. HEIGHT_LENGTH - Height/Length HEIGHT_LENGTHU - Height/Length Unit SEX - Sex L - Power Box-Cox transformation normality M - Median S - Coefficient variation parameter Anthropometric measurement parameter calculate z-score percentile condition expected input dataset VSTESTCD/PARAMCD want growth derivations: e.g. parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT". metadata available Weight available admiralpeds package. Weight measures expected unit "kg". analysis_var Variable containing anthropometric measurement numeric vector expected, e.g. AVAL, VSSTRESN set_values_to_sds Variables set Z-Scores specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_sds(exprs(PARAMCD = “WTASDS”, PARAM = “Weight--height z-score”)) defines parameter code parameter. formula calculate Z-score follows: $$\frac{((\frac{obs}{M})^L - 1)}{L * S}$$ "obs" observed value respective anthropometric measure calculated. Permitted Values: List variable-value pairs left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset set_values_to_pctl Variables set Percentile specified variables set specified values new observations. example, set_values_to_pctl(exprs(PARAMCD = “WTHPCTL”, PARAM = “Weight--height percentile”)) defines parameter code parameter. Permitted Values: List variable-value pair left default value, NULL, parameter derived output dataset

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
text: input dataset additional records new parameter added.

title: Derive Anthropometric indicators (Z-Scores/Percentiles-for-Height/Length) based on Standard Growth Charts — derive_params_growth_height
code: library(dplyr) library(lubridate) library(rlang) library(admiral)  advs <- dm_peds %>%   select(USUBJID, BRTHDTC, SEX) %>%   right_join(., vs_peds, by = "USUBJID") %>%   mutate(     VSDT = ymd(VSDTC),     BRTHDT = ymd(BRTHDTC)   ) %>%   derive_vars_duration(     new_var = AAGECUR,     new_var_unit = AAGECURU,     start_date = BRTHDT,     end_date = VSDT,     out_unit = "days"   )  heights <- vs_peds %>%   filter(VSTESTCD == "HEIGHT") %>%   select(USUBJID, VSSTRESN, VSSTRESU, VSDTC) %>%   rename(     HGTTMP = VSSTRESN,     HGTTMPU = VSSTRESU   )  advs <- advs %>%   right_join(., heights, by = c("USUBJID", "VSDTC"))  advs_under2 <- advs %>%   filter(AAGECUR < 730)  advs_over2 <- advs %>%   filter(AAGECUR >= 730.5)  who_under2 <- bind_rows(   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_lgth_boys %>%     mutate(       SEX = "M",       height_unit = "cm"     )   ),   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_lgth_girls %>%     mutate(       SEX = "F",       height_unit = "cm"     )   ) ) %>%   rename(     HEIGHT_LENGTH = Length,     HEIGHT_LENGTHU = height_unit   )  who_over2 <- bind_rows(   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_ht_boys %>%     mutate(       SEX = "M",       height_unit = "cm"     )   ),   (admiralpeds::who_wt_for_ht_girls %>%     mutate(       SEX = "F",       height_unit = "cm"     )   ) ) %>%   rename(     HEIGHT_LENGTH = Height,     HEIGHT_LENGTHU = height_unit   )   advs_under2 <- derive_params_growth_height(   advs_under2,   sex = SEX,   height = HGTTMP,   height_unit = HGTTMPU,   meta_criteria = who_under2,   parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT",   analysis_var = VSSTRESN,   set_values_to_sds = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGHSDS",     PARAM = "Weight-for-height z-score"   ),   set_values_to_pctl = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGHPCTL",     PARAM = "Weight-for-height percentile"   ) )  advs_over2 <- derive_params_growth_height(   advs_over2,   sex = SEX,   height = HGTTMP,   height_unit = HGTTMPU,   meta_criteria = who_over2,   parameter = VSTESTCD == "WEIGHT",   analysis_var = VSSTRESN,   set_values_to_sds = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGHSDS",     PARAM = "Weight-for-height z-score"   ),   set_values_to_pctl = exprs(     PARAMCD = "WGHPCTL",     PARAM = "Weight-for-height percentile"   ) )  bind_rows(advs_under2, advs_over2) #> # A tibble: 246 × 37 #>    USUBJID     BRTHDTC  SEX   STUDYID DOMAIN VSSEQ VSTESTCD VSTEST VSPOS VSORRES #>    <chr>       <chr>    <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <int> <chr>    <chr>  <chr> <chr>   #>  1 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         1 BMI      BMI    NA    16.577… #>  2 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         5 BMI      BMI    NA    16.615… #>  3 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS         9 BMI      BMI    NA    16.697… #>  4 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        13 BMI      BMI    NA    16.816… #>  5 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        17 BMI      BMI    NA    16.824… #>  6 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        21 BMI      BMI    NA    16.915… #>  7 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        25 BMI      BMI    NA    17.051… #>  8 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        29 BMI      BMI    NA    17.162… #>  9 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        33 BMI      BMI    NA    17.248… #> 10 01-701-1015 2013-01… F     CDISCP… VS        37 BMI      BMI    NA    17.433… #> # ℹ 236 more rows #> # ℹ 27 more variables: VSORRESU <chr>, VSSTRESC <chr>, VSSTRESN <dbl>, #> #   VSSTRESU <chr>, VSSTAT <chr>, VSLOC <chr>, VSBLFL <chr>, VISITNUM <dbl>, #> #   VISIT <chr>, VISITDY <int>, VSDTC <chr>, VSDY <int>, VSTPT <chr>, #> #   VSTPTNUM <dbl>, VSELTM <chr>, VSTPTREF <chr>, VSEVAL <chr>, EPOCH <chr>, #> #   VSDT <date>, BRTHDT <date>, AAGECUR <dbl>, AAGECURU <chr>, HGTTMP <dbl>, #> #   HGTTMPU <chr>, AVAL <dbl>, PARAMCD <chr>, PARAM <chr>
